A lot of people in the community, mainly low ranked players thought the AWP was very OP pre-nerf. TBH, how the AWP is now actually seems better to me than how it was.
I don't at all agree with the rifle changes, also considering NO ONE asked for them. Literally no one. The main 3 rifles were the only weapons I thought valve just wouldn't touch since they were nearly perfect, except that tapping wasn't as good as in other cs games.

Check SlothSquadron's thread in full details of what got changed.
https://www.reddit.com/r/GlobalOffensive/comments/3w1azc/in_depth_analysis_of_december_8_2015_weapon/
Rifles
Pre-update values are on the left, Post-update are on the right
AK-47 InaccuracyCrouch 4.81 - 5.00
RecoveryTimeCrouch 0.381571 - 0.45
RecoveryTimeStand 0.46 - 0.60000
M4A4 RecoveryTimeCrouch .302625 - 0.43
RecoveryTimeStand 0.423676 - 0.525
M4A1-S InaccuracyCrouchAlt 3.68 - 4.10
RecoveryTimeCrouch 0.302625 - 0.43
RecoveryTimeStand 0.423676 - 0.525
No InaccuracyCrouchAlt for M4a4, http://i.imgur.com/lePWkQ6.jpg
Fun fact: The m4a4's spray didn't get changed, only recovery time. They only changed the spray of m4a1-s and AK.

Personally I never use the AUG/Krieg. The thing is, valve is trying to make all weapons viable even though that's just stupid. They nerf things to make other things viable, even though the things they nerf are just the correct and best way to play. Now people will still use the AK/M4, even though they could switch AUG/Krieg. When they nerfed the M4a1-s people expected a lot of people to switch to the AUG, did it happen though? Nope. Nearly everyone kept using M4a1-s or M4a4. I genuinely don't see the point of making things viable when every weapon already is viable just in different situations, which valve does not seem to understand.
